Steps.Message: Update at 08:16 - Our engineers have arrived on site in the NR31 9 area area to investigate a fault on a piece of network equipment currently affecting 70 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off. Using an average timescale for this type of issue, we're looking to have you back on between 09:30 and 10:30. Please follow the government pandemic guidelines about social distancing when interacting with our staff.

We became aware of this power cut at 07:29. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Logs.Comment: Update at 08:16 - Our engineers have arrived on site in the NR31 9 area area to investigate a fault on a piece of network equipment currently affecting 70 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off. Using an average timescale for this type of issue, we're looking to have you back on between 09:30 and 10:30. Please follow the government pandemic guidelines about social distancing when interacting with our staff.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We were investigating an issue on the high voltage electricity network that caused power issues in the area.
